abstract: Text 1: ff. 1ra-51va: Lives of our fathers and brothers  (Inc.: f. 1ra,4-10: ዝንቱ፡ ክፍል፡ ራብዕ፡ እመጽሐፈ፡ ገድሎሙ፡ ወስምዖሙ፡ ለአበዊነ፡ ወአኃዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ለበስያነ፡ መስቀል፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ በወርኀ፡ ሳኔ፡; - “This is the fourth chapter from the Book of the Lives of our holy fathers and brothers who weared the cross, that is read in the month of Sane”); Text 2: ff. 52ra-67vb: Life of Bärtälomewos: f. 52rb2-6: ዜና፡ ገድሉ፡ ወስነ፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ለአብ፡ ብፁዕ፡ አቡነ፡ በርተሎሜዎስ፡ መምህረ፡ ንጽሕ።  … - “The Story of the combat and beauty of the virtue of our blessed father Bärtälomewos, the teacher of purity”; Text 3: ff. 68ra-104va: f. 68ra7-11: ገድለ፡ ቅዱሳት፡ አንስት። ወምእምናት፡ እለ፡ ወፅአ፡ እምብሔረ፡ ትግራይ።  - ”Life of the holy and believing women, who came from the land of Təgray”; Text 4: ff. 105ra-138vb; f. 105ra4-10: ክፍል፡ ቀዳሚ፡ … ዘእምገድለ፡ አበዊነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ገርዜናውያን፡  - “Chapter 1 … of the Lives of our holy Fathers of Garzen (= Gundä Gunde)”

abstract: Text 1: ff. 1ra-48va: Life of abunä Isayəyas (1rb9-1va1: ንዜኑ፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምስነ፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ወሕቡአተ፡ ገድሉ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ትሩፈ፡ ምግባር፡ ተጋዳሊ፡ በእንተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አቡነ፡ ኢሳይያስ።); Text 2: ff. 50ra-107rb: Life of abunä Gäbrä Krəstos (f. 50ra6-10: ንዜኑ፡ ስነ፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ወሕቡአተ፡ ገድሉ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ አቡነ፡ ክርስቶስ።); Text 3: ff. 109ra- 166rb: Life of abunä Habtä Śəllase (I) (109rb5fb-109va2: ንዌጥን፡ ዜና፡ ልደቱ፡ ወተኃጽኖቱ፡ ወነገረ፡ ዕበዩ፡ ወፃማ፡ ምግባሩ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ክቡር፡ ወቅዱስ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡)
notes: Cp. GG-009; f. 1r, upper margin: “Isayəyas was the son of Abel; Gäbrä Krəstos was from the family of the seyums of Lakma; Habtä Śəllase was [from the people of] Irom [= Irob]”; f. 166rv,2-1 fb: “It was written in the year 7202” (of the era of the word, i.e. 1709 AD); a later note on f. 167v (in Amharic) mentions däjjazmach Säbagadis (1822-31), and abunä Gäbrä Masih (III, d. 1856), thus probably indicating the former owner and the donation of the ms to the monastery

abstract: Text 1: ff. 15r-59r: Life of Mäzgäbä Śəllase; (abbot of the Gunda Gunde monastery 1663-1716); Text 2: ff. 60r-72ra: Another Life of Mäzgäbä Śəllase; Text 3: ff. 72rb1-10: Sälam for Mäzgäbä Śəllase; Text 4: ff. 77ra-81rb7: Sälam /Mälkə᾽ for Mäzgäbä Śəllase; Text 5: ff. 81rb8-81vb: Another Sälam for Mäzgäbä Śəllase; Text 6: ff. 82ra-81vb: Mälkə᾽ for ᾽Ǝsṭifanos (the founder of the Stephanite monastic order)
decoration_description: Miniatures: Portraits of monastic figures: 1. f. 1 v: abunä Täklä Haymanot; abunä ᾽Ǝsṭifanos; 2. f. 2 v: abunä ᾽Abäkəräzun; abunä Gäbrä Mäsiḥ; 3. f. 3 v: abunä Yäwo[s]ṭatewos; abunä Bärsoma; 4. f. 4 v: abunä Bärtälomewos; abunä Habtä Śəllase; 5. f. 5 r: abunä Täklä Nabiyat; abunä Isayas; 6. f. 6 r: abunä Gäbrä K[r]əs[t]os; abunä Yəsḥaq; 7. f. 7 v: abunä Iyosab; abunä Gäbrä Mäsiḥ Dagəmay (the Second); 8. f. 8 v: abunä Samu᾽el; abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase; 9. f. 11 r: abunä Habtä Śəllase Dagəmawi (the Second); abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase and the Angel of Death; Narrative scenes: 10. f. 12 r: abba Tənśa᾽e Krəstos, the brother of abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase; and abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase and the fig tree that fell by his prayer; 11. f. 12 v: abba Habtä Maryam, the disciple of abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase; and abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase who divided a great river; 12. f. 13 r: abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase; and female suppliant Wälättä Ṣəyon; 13. f. 13 v: abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase receiving kidan from Jesus; 14. f. 14 v: abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllase bringing out children from a house on fire (painted twice)
notes: f. 72rb11-72vb11; ff. 72vb12-73ra,end; ff. 73va-74ra: three notes in Amharic mentioning local lords (including Säbagadis, 1822-31); ff. 74v-76v empty

abstract: Text 1: ff.1r-3va,end: an acephalous fragment of a text concerning the persecution of monks who would not calumniate ᾽Ǝsṭifanos (f. 1rb,13), also naming the death of abbot Gäbrä Krəstos (f. 1va,6-7) in prison; Text 2: ff. 4r-159ra: Lives of the Brothers (the followers of ᾽Ǝsṭifanos), no specific title (this text is different from the one published by Getatchew Haile, A History of the First Ǝsṭifanosite Monks, (CSCO 635-36, Scr Aeth 112-113), Lovanii 2011)

name4: of the texts 2-4, from Arabic, according to note f. 74v,5-end: Abba Sälama (the 2nd, Metropolitan of Eth. 1348-88), called erroneously here Käsate Bərhan, which is the sobriquet of Abba Sälama I (4th cent. AD)
abstract: Text 1: ff. 5r-20v: ድርሳን፡ ዘይቤ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማሪ፡ ኤፍሬም፡ ሶርያዊ። በእንተ፡ አብርሃም፡ አበ፡ አበው፡ ዓርከ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበእንተ፡ ሳራ፡ ብእሲቱ። - Homily of Mari Efrem the Syrian on Abraham, the patriarch, the friend of God, and on Sara in Egypt; Text 2: ff. 21r-47v: Death and departure of Patriarchs Abraham, Isaac and Jacob; (f. 21r,2-4: ዝውእቱ፡ ፍልሰቶሙ፡ ወፀአቶሙ፡ ለአበው፡ አብርሃም፡ ይስሓቅ፡ ወያዕቆብ።); Text 3: ff. 48r-58r: Death of Patriarch Isaac and departure (of his soul) from his body; (f. 48r,2-4: ዝንቱ፡ ዕረፍቱ፡ ለአብ፡ ይስሓቅ፡ ወፍልሰቱ፡ እምሥጋሁ፡ …); Text 4: ff. 58v-74v: Death of our Father Jacob who was called Israel, and departure (of his soul) from his body; (f. 58v,2-4: ዕረፍቱ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ እስራኤል። ወፍልሰቱ፡ እምሥጋሁ፡ …); Text 5: ff. 74v-80v: Poem (sälam) in honour of the names of Patriarchs Abraham, Isaac and Jacob; (f.74v,1: ሰላም፡ ለዝክረ፡ ስምክሙ፡...); Text 6: ff. 81v,1-90v,8: Poem (sälam) in honour of the Christian Church (beginning damaged); Text 7: ff. 91r,1-97r,6: Teaching of the holy faith by Cyril as written in the book called Ärmas; (f. 91r,2-4: ትምህርተ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ቅድስት፡ ዘነበበ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቄርሎስ፡ በውስተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ዘስሙ፡ አርማስ። …)
notes: f. 1r: a text has been erased; ff. 1v, 2v: pen trials; ff. 2r, 3r-4v, 81r, 97v, I [= 98]r&v empty
holdingsdigital: 1. University of Toronto Scarborough Library   2. Hill Museum and Monastic Library, Collegeville, Minnesota, USA

abstract: Text 1: ff. 2v-16v: Life of Abunä Yəsḥaq; beginning lost; Text 2: ff. 17r-f.40va: Life of Abunä Iyosab of Däbrä Gärizan; (f. 17r,12-15: (ናሁ፡ ንዜኑ፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምዜና፡ ገድሉ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወለቅዱስ፡ አቡነ፡ ኢዮሳብ፡ መምህረ፡ ሕግ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ገሪዛን፡); Text 3: ff. 41r-106v: Life of Abunä Gäbrä Mäsiḥ the Second (Abbot of GG); (f. 41ra,3fb-rb,5fb:  (ንዜኑ፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምዜናሁ፡ እስመ፡ ሠናየ፡ ገድል፡ ውእቱ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ወለቅዱስ፡ አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መሲሕ፡ ዳግማዊ፡ መምህረ፡ ሕግ፡ መንፈሳዊ፡ … ዘቆመ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አብ፡ ክቡር፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ በደብረ፡ ገሪዛን፡); Text 4: ff. 107r-136v: Life of Abunä Sam᾽uel (Abbot of GG); (f. 107rb,1-va,1: ንጽሕፍ፡ ኅዳጠ፡ እምስነ፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ወዜና፡ ገድሉ፡ ለ… ሊቀ፡ ጽሙዳን፡ መምህረ፡ ሕግ፡ … ዘቆመ፡ ዲበ፡ መንበረ፡ አብ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡ … አቡነ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ፍቅር፡ ወሰላም፡ ወላእክ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ገሪዛን፡)
decoration_description: Miniature of Abunä Yəsḥaq:  f. 1v; Ornamented quire numbers; (e.g.: ff. 116v-117r, 126-127)
notes: f. 1r: unfinished note on the ethnic origin of the abbots whose lives are extant in the ms.; ff. IIr-IIIv (foreguard), IVr, Vr (rearguard) - empty; ff. IVv, Vv: scrawling notes; ff. 131r-end: text damaged; Reading attention marks in red; Several hands, or the mss is composite
holdingsdigital: 1. University of Toronto Scarborough Library   2. Hill Museum and Monastic Library, Collegeville, Minnesota, USA
physical_description_notes: Number of folios: 3 (I-III) + 136 + 2 (IV-V); European foliation; Number of quires: 18; Number of columns of the text: 2; Number of lines in columns: 14-17 (ff. 105-106: 19-20)
binding: Two wooden boards; rests of the leather cover at the inner side of the front board

name3: Abunä Mäzgäbä Śəllaśe I, abbot: 1664-1716; (f. 150rb1-2: … ለዝንቱ፡ ገድል፡ ዘአጽሐፎ፡ አቡነ፡ መዝገበ፡ ሥላሤ፡)
abstract: Text 1: ff. 1ra-38ra3: Gädlä ᾽Abunä [Zä-Mika᾽el] ᾽Arägawi; (f. 1ra, upper margin: ገድለ፡ አቡነ፡ አረጋዊ፡; f. 1va,2 fb-1vb,8: ንጽሕፍ፡… ዜና፡ ኂሩቱ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ … አቡነ፡ ዘሚካኤል፡ ዘውእቱ፡ አረጋዊ፡  - “Story of…  ᾽Abunä Zä-Mika᾽el, who is (also known as) ᾽Arägawi”); Text 2: ff. 38ra,4-38vb,12: Genealogy of the monks, starting with Antony; (f. 38ra4-5: ዝውእቱ፡ ጥንተ፡ ልደቶሙ፡ ለመነኮሳት። እንጦንዮስ፡ … ); Text 3: ff. 42ra-67vb: Gädlä Gäbrä Krəstos; (f. 42ra, upper margin: ገድለ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡); Gäbrä Krəstos is in other Christian traditions known as St. Alexis
